page.title: 09The Axminster to Lyme Train
page.content:
In 1903 the Axminster to Lyme Regis Railway line opened. On the trains goods were carried such as, coal, cattle, sheep, milk in churns, lamb and farm produce.
The passenger service started with six trains each way every day with the maximum of ten in the summer months. It was called the "Bluebell"line because some parts were covered with bluebells.
It took three years to build.It was in use for 62 years.Now it is just thistles and grass.A bridge opening has been blocked off with barbed wire.Although it has been recemented underneath there is a big crack in the middle.
